action.action-desc: Mr. Steube introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to provide assistance for common interest communities, condominiums, and housing cooperatives damaged by a major disaster, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Clean Up Disasters and Emergencies with Better Recovery and Immediate Support Act or the Clean Up DEBRIS Act.
Section 102 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5122) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term residential common interest community means any mandatory membership organization comprising owners of real estate described in a declaration or created pursuant to a covenant or other applicable law with respect to which a person, by virtue of the person’s ownership of a unit, is obligated to pay for a share of real estate taxes, insurance premiums, maintenance, or improvement of, or services or other expenses related to, common elements, other units, or any other real estate other than that unit described in the declaration.

The term condominium means a stand-alone condominium project in which each dwelling unit is separately owned, in which the remaining portions of the real estate are designated for common ownership solely by the owners of the related units, each owner having an undivided interest in the common elements, and which is represented by an association consisting exclusively of all the unit owners in the project, which is, or will be responsible for the operation, administration, and management of the project.

The term housing cooperative means a multi-unit housing entity, including an association of manufactured homes, in which each dwelling unit is subject to separate use and possession by 1 or more cooperative members whose interest in such unit, and in any undivided assets of the cooperative association that are appurtenant to such unit, is evidenced by a membership or share interest in a cooperative association and a lease or other document of title or possession granted by such cooperative as the owner of all cooperative property.

section.header: Removal of debris resulting from a major disaster in residential common interest communities
section.text: Section 407 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5173) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (e) and (f); and
by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

subsection.header: Rules relating to residential common interest communities

paragraph.text: The President shall issue rules which provide that removal of debris or wreckage from a unit of real estate within a residential common interest community, condominium entity, or an entity of a housing cooperative from a major disaster is in the public interest when a State or local government determines in writing such debris or wreckage constitutes a threat to life, to public health or safety, or to the economic recovery of the residential common interest community.
In issuing the rules under paragraph (1), the President shall be deferential to defined terms in State or local laws and ordinances.

section.header: Condominiums and housing cooperatives damaged by a major disaster
section.text: Section 408(c)(2)(A) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5174(c)(2)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i) by striking and at the end;
by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii); and
by adding after clause (i) the following:

clause.text: the repair of essential common elements of a condominium or housing cooperative (such as a roof, exterior wall, heating and cooling equipment, elevator, stairwell, utility access, plumbing, and electricity) provided an individual’s or household’s pro rata share of essential common element repair costs are satisfactorily documented; and

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply to a major disaster or emergency declared by the President under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.) on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
